channel.title: Super Computing Challenge for School
channel.description:
Ok so I am on a team from my school to compete against other schools on computer programming. So far we are either coding in Java or Netlogo which is a java based script. I just was wondering what is a good idea to do? 1st place gets a $15,000 scholarship for the college of their choice. Any ideas?
The website for this is here: http://www.challenge.nm.org/

item.title: Super Computing Challenge for School
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

Hmm… All the ideas sound interesting but my teacher says the judges look for a simulation that holds an answer that is not know. Then we would need evidence to back up our statement.

Read full topic

item.title: Super Computing Challenge for School
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Build your own virtual machine interpreter that compiles a generic assembly language into the respective assembly instruction set of the machine the VM is running on, and then execute it.

Read full topic

item.description:
@xryz wrote:

http://www.redhat.com/support/wpapers/redhat/gcj/gcj.pdf , or http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_processor <-- does that mean u can write a pure java os without a jvm?

Read full topic

item.title: Super Computing Challenge for School
item.dc:creator: @Andrew_Ferguson The317Guy
item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

runewings317:

Would a mobile OS in java be possible? Such as a cellphone or MP3 player?

I would say yes because most cell phones support java and a few flash but it would be very inefficient due to space restrictions and dedicated memory. Basically you would have to flush a EVO 4G which is like $300 and reformat it to be able to do anything really worth doing.

Read full topic

item.title: Super Computing Challenge for School
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“Andrew Ferguson, post:4, topic:412945”]I get that it’s it’s a contest for coding but what are the guidelines, are there any requirements or rules. Or is this a free for fall, anything you want?

Make a Java OS

As java needs the JVM and has dependencies it cannot be done without major knowledge within making an OS. Then, your best bet would be just to have the JVM built into the OS instead. The odds of an OS in Java is very slim as it would require far too much work.

While you would need JVM to do anything with Java you could still duel boot the OS with another OS with JVM installed and have it rip data off that, or preload the OS with JVM and build it in a virtual machine.[/quote]

You would still need a low-level language…

http://www.jnode.org/

Like I said, it still uses a low-level language, in this case, Assembly.

Read full topic

item.description:
@Andrew_Ferguson wrote:

I get that it’s it’s a contest for coding but what are the guidelines, are there any requirements or rules. Or is this a free for fall, anything you want?

[quote=“CoonHunter, post:3, topic:412945”][quote author=runewings317 link=topic=514417.msg3734335#msg3734335 date=1314830564]
Make a Java OS
[/quote]
As java needs the JVM and has dependencies it cannot be done without major knowledge within making an OS. Then, your best bet would be just to have the JVM built into the OS instead. The odds of an OS in Java is very slim as it would require far too much work.[/quote]
While you would need JVM to do anything with Java you could still duel boot the OS with another OS with JVM installed and have it rip data off that, or preload the OS with JVM and build it in a virtual machine.

Read full topic
